channel.title: Posts on Joost's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Joost's blog

item.title: Bye bye Wordpress, Hello Hugo
item.description: This site has been running on Wordpress ever since it conception back in 2012.

item.title: How to run SPCAF v5 analysis during TeamBuild in TFS 2013
item.description: This how-to is based on the SPCAF how-to written for TFS 2012.

item.title: How to run SPCAF v4 analysis during TeamBuild in TFS 2013
item.description: Update October 15, 2014: This post is based on SPCAF version 4.

item.title: MSDN Subscriber downloads using Internet Explorer 11
item.description: Internet Explorer 11, that ships with Windows 8.1 and comes as an update for Windows 7, has some problems launching the File Transfer Manager on the MSDN Subscriber Downloads section.

item.title: Windows Server 2012 R2 installation on HP MicroServer N40L fails
item.description: This weekend I planned to install Windows Server 2012 R2 Essentials on my HP ProLiant MicroServer N40L to replace my WHS 2011 installation.

item.title: Display MVC 5 web site in an IFrame
item.description: ASP.Net MVC 5 automatically adds a HTTP header called X-Frame-Options with the value SAMEORIGIN to your web application.

item.title: Localized resource for token ‘Direction’ could not be found
item.description: You have created a neat SharePoint feature that works great. But in the logs files several errors pop up as soon as you deploy the new feature, complaining about a Localized resource token ‘Direction’.

item.title: Track bugs as backlog items
item.description: When you are using the CMMI project template in TFS 2012 and use the Backlog to track your Work Items there are scenarios where you want to see Bugs in your Backlog.

item.title: Load JQuery scripts from a CDN with local fallback
item.description: How many unique visitors you’ve got last month? I bet the number is still under 1 billion, right?

item.title: Modify the groups listed when granting permissions to a site
item.description: When you click the button ‘Grant Permissions’ in the Permission screen of a site you always get the option to insert a user inside a SharePoint group.
